WorkItem.Description:
Pretty new here so apologies if this is posted in wrong area. I have a Druid that often switches specs dependent upon what the guild needs for a raid. I love RAWR and have multiple saved files for each spec (Resto, Cat, Bear and Moonkin) but have noticed that when switching the spec RAWR often crashes. From then on, that release of RAWR is unuseable. Here is the error message I get:
 
See the end of this message for details on invoking 
just-in-time (JIT) debugging instead of this dialog box.
 
************** Exception Text **************
System.FormatException: Input string was not in a correct format.
at System.Number.StringToNumber(String str, NumberStyles options, NumberBuffer& number, NumberFormatInfo info, Boolean parseDecimal)
at System.Number.ParseInt32(String s, NumberStyles style, NumberFormatInfo info)
at System.Xml.XmlConvert.ToInt32(String s)
at Microsoft.Xml.Serialization.GeneratedAssembly.XmlSerializationReaderCalculationOptionsTree.Read4_CalculationOptionsTree(Boolean isNullable, Boolean checkType)
at Microsoft.Xml.Serialization.GeneratedAssembly.XmlSerializationReaderCalculationOptionsTree.Read5_CalculationOptionsTree()
WorkItem.Summary: [Tree] Crashes after switching to different saved files

Comments.Message: This occurs when changing talent points, or when switching which druid model you're using? Can you attach the character files?

I appreciate you guys are busy but I was wondering if there were any updates on this issue? Pretty much every time I open a saved model, RAWR crashes now

Jae
